situation.title: Health resorts
situation.meta_description: It is only possible to offer rehabilitation and spa care that is at least partially funded from the public health insurance.

content.processed:
Rules and recommendations

Rehabilitation and recreational spa care can be provided. The spa can also provide wellness holiday stays, but it is important to follow hygiene and organizational measures.

Do not forget to wear a face mask in the common areas. If you develop symptoms of a respiratory illness (especially cough or difficulty breathing) or fever before leaving, you should consult your doctor whether you should go for tests or postpone your stay. The more considerate you are to other spa guests and staff, while adhering to basic hygiene measures, the safer the spa will be for everyone.

Operators of spa facilities must regularly disinfect all areas (especially handles, corridors, railings, elevators, toilets, etc.). It is also important to take extra care to clean the rooms and handle towels and bedding. This will significantly reduce the risk of infection (for both residents and employees). We also recommend regular ventilation of the areas where possible.

There can be a maximum of 10 people at a time in indoor pools, saunas, etc. The exception is members of one household. The limit is 50 people in the case of outdoor pools.

The hotel restaurant may be open between 10PM and 6AM. All guests must be seated, with a maximum of 4 people at the table and a maximum occupancy of 50% of the restaurant's capacity.

questions_answers.question: Can I go to the spa if I have a coronavirus?
Can I stay at a hotel for business purposes?
Can I go to the spa after a surgery if my doctor has prescribed them?
Are visits allowed at the spa resort?
Can the public enter the spa area?
questions_answers.value: Yes, under the same conditions as other public places, .ie. in groups of max. 10 people, outdoors 50. Unless they are members of one household.

questions_answers.question: Can I go to the spa pool if I'm not staying at the spa?
questions_answers.value: Yes, but there can be a maximum of 10 people at a time, except for members of one household.

questions_answers.question: Is a negative test required on arrival at the spa?
questions_answers.value: No, but your temperature can be measured.

questions_answers.question: Do I have to wear a face mask in the common areas of the spa?
questions_answers.value: Yes, or respirator and neckerchief over the mouth and nose.

questions_answers.question: What is the name of the spa discount program?
questions_answers.value: Vouchers are provided within the COVID-Spa compensation program. However, vouchers can only be used in one of the spas, so check your availability at kudyznudy.cz before purchasing a specific stay.

update.processed:
• The spa may only provide stays paid for by the health insurance company.
  • Visits are prohibited.

Specific rules, necessary organisational measures and exceptions will be specified in the newly issued government regulations when announcing the PES level 4. The exact date is not known and will depend on the epidemiological situation, according to the PES points system.
